income_messages:
From: o**********************0@mail.com
To: CRAWLER
Time: 2023-04-11 15:14:34
SUBJECT:   Supreme Court of Nigeria
  Supreme Court of Nigeria
Three-Arms Zone
P.M.B. 308. Garki Abuja
Greetings Dear Unpaid Beneficiary,
This is to inform you that in the course of my investigation as
director of payment verification / implementation committee I came
across your name as unpaid fund beneficiary in the record of the
central bank of Nigeria and other banks that are supposed to get your
funds released to you. My committee was set up by the payment
reconciliation committee to verify and scrutinize all outstanding
debts owed to our foreign beneficiaries in accordance to the
information received from the United States government and other
countries over unpaid huge debts owed to Foreigners.
Having seen your file and my further questioning to the officials of
the central Nigeria bank and ministry of finance as to why your
payment is still pending reveals the rot and corruption in the system.
The bank officials told me that the reason why you haven't received
your payment is due to your inability to pay for the required charges
for transfer of funds to your account. When I asked them why they
didn't deduct the said charges from your principal sum, I was given
the flimsy excuse that you never authorized them to do so. When I put
the question across to them if they ever advised you that such charges
could be deducted from your principal fund,the answer I got was no.
Now, if you do not tell this beneficiary that such charges could be
deducted from his or her principal fund, how will he or she know that
such options are available for such beneficiaries.
From my investigation I discovered that these bank officials
deliberately refused to let the charges be deducted from your
principal fund because they want your fund to remain trapped in the
bank, while they continue to extort money from beneficiaries under
some flimsy excuse. You do not need to pay any money to any official,
all you are required to do is swear an affidavit at the federal high
court of Nigeria, authorizing the bank to deduct all charges from your
principal fund and transfer the balance of funds after deduction to
your bank account. If you have spent any money in the past in your
quest for payment, kindly let me know so that I can follow this up.
You get back to me immediately in my email for a directive on how you
can get the deduction done as soon as possible and get your payment
also.
Yours sincerely,
Olukayode Ariwoola GCON
New Chief Justice of Nigeria
Email:-olukayodeariwoolagcon110@mail.com   
From: o**********************0@mail.com
To: fh53218@m**************m
Time: 2023-04-11 16:52:01
SUBJECT: Re: Supreme Court of Nigeria
Supreme Court of Nigeria 
Three-Arms Zone 
P.M.B. 308. Garki Abuja. 
 Attn: Dear Esteem Beneficiary 
 I received your message and duly noted the contents. Do not panic of 
fear you will receive your overdue funds now without any hitch ok. 
The amount approved to pay you is $15.5m. 
 You see, I am newly appointed as the Chief Justice of Nigeria on 27 June 2022. 
I am assuring you that you will receive your overdue fund 
without any problem by the special grace of the ALMIGHTY GOD, if we 
can work with TRUST ONE MIND AND UNDERSTANDING. 
 As I stated in my first mail, you are not supposed to pay any cent to 
your payee bank because your fund is with the bank. They suppose to 
deduct all charges such as COST OF TRANSFER, TAX, BANK STAMP DUTY, 
COURIER COST etc, from the principal sum and transfer the balance of 
your fund to you after they deducted all the charges. 
 As I advised you in my first message what you need now to do is to swear 
an affidavit at the Federal High Court of Nigeria very important, it 
will authorize the bank to deduct all charges from the principal fund 
and transfer the balance of your fund to you after deduction. 
 My friend, this process will require your present at the Federal High Court 
of Nigeria to swear the affidavit, the ONLY FEE you will pay in person 
at Federal High Court of Nigeria is $50 for the swearing of the 
affidavit but if you cannot come and need an attorney here to help you 
swear the affidavit at the Federal High Court of Nigeria, we have an 
accredited attorney who will help you swear the affidavit at the 
Federal High Court of Nigeria you are not paying him any cent because 
he is working under the Federal High Court of Nigeria. The only fee 
you will pay for the affidavit which is $50 only. 
 NOTE: Once you pay the $50 and the affidavit is sworn the payee 
bank will have the legal right to deduct all the charges as stated 
above and release your fund to you without demanding from you to send 
any upfront payment. 
 If you are pleased to proceed, kindly send to me your full receiving 
bank details if you choose to receive your fund via bank to bank wire 
transfer BUT if you want to receive it via ATM CARD OR CHECK OR CASH MAILING, kindly 
send your receiving address so that it will be forwarded to the 
payee bank. And make sure you send the $50 to enable the 
accredited attorney help you swear an affidavit immediately asap so 
that the payee bank can have the legal right to deduct all the charges 
from the principal fund and release your fund to you. 
 You are advice to try and make sure you send the $50 for the 
affidavit today so that the attorney will go to the 
Federal High Court of Nigeria to swear the affidavit to enable the 
Payee bank have the legal backup to deduct all the charges and release 
your over-due fund to you. 
 NOTE: You're allowed and permitted to ask questions. 
 Yours sincerely Olukayode Ariwoola GCON 
New Chief Justice of Nigeria 
E-Mail: olukayodeariwoolagcon110@mail.com
outbound_messages:

SUBJECT: Re:   Supreme Court of Nigeria
Hi Olukayode,

 Regards,
Ramon
